Note: Participant notices a delay in the MR glasses notifying them of a new message that was actually received sooner
Glasses do not alert participant of new message received when display has been asleep while performing other task but they feel a buzz in the neural band
Participant notices that volume is choppy
Participant appears to be lifting chin up when looking at information on screen
Participant notices a purple tinge around the text on screen which is not bothersome until it is against a light background which produces a glare

Participant expresses desire for Meta to display information in a less cluttered way and more digestible by sharing information as it is speaking aloud with option to scroll later or pop up bubbles that are slightly ahead of Meta
Participant feels inclined to look toward the left while on video call and sitting in green chair
Participant appears to be lifting chin up while on video call within MR display
Participant removed object in front of solid black TV background before starting Lego task so that they may see images clearer
Participant continues to describe offset 3D overlapping effect when viewing contents in MR display, contributing to their perception of a fuzzy screen
Started session with watching a YouTube video on external phone while messaging in WhatsApp through the glasses since OTA error occurred with live captions
Participant expresses slight annoyance with display timing out while they are analyzing Lego images
Participant decides that viewing images indoors increases clarity due to black solid background
Participant appears to be squinting and poking head forward slightly as if to see images more closely
Participant describes the reason for their squinting as a result of the offset 3D layering effect previously described
Participant says the offset 3D layering effect does not affect clarity of details but is generally annoying
Participant notices that objects in images do not appear true to color as they mistook an orange Lego in the image for a red one
Participant notices that different shades of blue also appear difficult to differentiate between on the MR display
I’ve noticed that participant often mistakenly performs unintended actions like calling someone in WhatsApp when they meant to return to the previous page

Participant notices that because screen times out so quickly, the double tap activation gesture becomes second nature and when attempting to go back or to select something, they feel an inherent pull to double tap instead of using correct hand gesture

Participant notices that the delay between a performed hand gesture and the action performed in the screen also contributes to unintended mistakes/actions since they feel inclined to perform the gesture again thinking it was not properly registered
Participant finds that they must be intentional, patient, and highly aware of finger dexterity to perform proper hand gesture for intended action
Participant says they are constantly looking up toward black background and down as they can’t look at images through a busy background since the screen lightens up significantly
Participant feels a neck strain from having to look toward a specific solid background and back down at Legos constantly
